timeline.title: Week 1: Foundation in Mathematics
timeline.description: Start with basic mathematical concepts crucial for GATE CSE.
tasks: Review linear algebra basics (vectors, matrices, operations)
Practice basic problems from a standard textbook

timeline.title: Week 2: Discrete Mathematics & Aptitude
timeline.description: Focus on discrete mathematics and aptitude.
tasks: Study set theory, graph theory, combinatorics
Practice aptitude questions (logical reasoning, quantitative aptitude)
Solve previous year's GATE aptitude questions

timeline.title: Week 3: Introduction to Computer Science Fundamentals
tasks: Study C programming basics (data types, control structures, functions)
Understand basic data structures (arrays, linked lists)
Practice coding problems on HackerRank or CodeChef

timeline.title: Week 4: Data Structures & Algorithms I
timeline.description: Deep dive into data structures and algorithms.
tasks: Study stacks, queues, trees, and their applications
Solve algorithm problems on LeetCode or GeeksforGeeks

timeline.title: Week 5: Data Structures & Algorithms II
timeline.description: Continue with more advanced data structures and algorithms.
tasks: Implement advanced algorithms (dynamic programming, greedy algorithms)

timeline.title: Week 6: Databases and Operating Systems
timeline.description: Cover fundamental concepts of databases and operating systems.
tasks: Learn basic operating system concepts (processes, threads, scheduling)
Solve practice questions from previous years

timeline.title: Week 7: Computer Networks & Compiler Design
timeline.description: Study Computer Networks and Compiler Design.
tasks: Understand compiler design basics (lexical analysis, parsing)
Solve problems related to these topics

timeline.title: Week 8: Theory of Computation & Revision I
timeline.description: Cover Theory of Computation and begin thorough revision.

timeline.title: Week 9: Revision II & Mock Tests
timeline.description: Focused revision and intensive mock test practice.
tasks: Analyze mistakes and improve weak areas

timeline.title: Week 10: Revision III & Strategy
timeline.description: Final revision and strategizing for the exam.

timeline.title: Week 11: Mock Tests & Analysis
timeline.description: Final set of mock tests and detailed analysis.

timeline.title: Week 12: Final Revision & Exam Prep
timeline.description: Final revision and exam day preparation.

daily: Solve at least 10 coding problems or practice questions
weekly: Plan for the next week's study
